intro: Mentha belgica, commonly known as Belgian mint, is a perennial herb native to Europe. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that have a strong minty scent. Its flowers are small, tubular, and usually pink or purple, arranged in whorls along the stems. Mentha belgica is often found in moist meadows and along stream banks, where it thrives in partial shade to full sun.
